2000.query: Manhattan Associates supply chain WMS competitors 2000
2000.context: Manhattan Associates, Inc. is a supply chain and omnichannel software company focused on warehouse management, transportation, and retail solutions. Warehouse management system leader.

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Major ERP and supply chain software provider with warehouse logistics solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Enterprise software provider with warehouse management capabilities

competitors.name: i2 Technologies
competitors.notes: Supply chain planning and optimization software (later acquired by JDA in 2010)

competitors.name: RedPrairie
competitors.notes: WMS and supply chain execution software provider

2005.context: Manhattan Associates, Inc. is a supply chain and omnichannel software company focused on warehouse management, transportation, and retail solutions. Expanded to transportation and retail.

competitors.name: RedPrairie
competitors.notes: Major WMS and supply chain competitor, later became Blue Yonder

competitors.name: HighJump Software
competitors.notes: WMS and supply chain execution competitor, later acquired by Körber

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Enterprise software giant with warehouse management and supply chain solutions

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Competitor with Oracle Warehouse Management and supply chain applications

competitors.name: JDA Software
competitors.notes: Supply chain planning and execution software competitor, later became Blue Yonder

competitors.name: i2 Technologies
competitors.notes: Supply chain management software provider active in mid-2000s

2010.query: Manhattan Associates supply chain WMS competitors 2010
2010.context: Manhattan Associates, Inc. is a supply chain and omnichannel software company focused on warehouse management, transportation, and retail solutions. Cloud platform development. Omnichannel commerce.

competitors.name: SAP
competitors.notes: Market leader with $1.317 billion in 2010 revenue, SAP EWM establishing foothold in automated warehouses

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Second largest with $1.21 billion in 2010 revenue, strong in enterprise WMS

competitors.name: JDA Software
competitors.notes: $362 million in 2010 revenue, acquired i2 Technologies in early 2010, later became Blue Yonder

competitors.name: RedPrairie
competitors.notes: $94 million in 2010 revenue, competed closely with Manhattan in WMS market

competitors.name: Accellos
competitors.notes: WMS solutions provider, later acquired by Aptean

competitors.notes: Competitor with Oracle Warehouse Management and supply chain applications

competitors.notes: Enterprise software provider with WMS and supply chain solutions

competitors.name: HighJump (Körber)
competitors.notes: Supply chain execution and WMS competitor

competitors.name: Amber Road
competitors.notes: Global trade management and supply chain visibility provider
